website_summaries.verdict: Easy to use and able to generate a shower of sparks for quick fire starting.
pros: Good grip on the wood handle
Also built with a ruler, map scale and bottle opener on the scraper
cons: The wooden piece sometimes can break away from the metal striker

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for outdoorsmen.
customer_reviews.text: I found this ferro rod on an Amazon search and I must say it is my favorite among a large field of generic and brand name competitors alike. The wood handle looks handsome with a good grip and the slightly larger rod make it easier to throw big sparks. The larger diameter rod fits perfectly in the Benchmade 162 sheath, and I was able to put the small measuring piece on a shock cord so I can keep them together. I am going to buy the XL rod for my emergency kit. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Sergio Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Gives off a mighty spark that is super hot! I was able to ignite wood chips with it this afternoon. The wood handle on it is great. Feels really good in the hand allows a great grip for getting a ton of friction across the rod.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Anspach

customer_reviews.title: Glad I also ordered a Light My Fire army model
customer_reviews.text: The tip of the rod is bent. Not worth returning as it will still work, but for the price how about a straight rod? Glad I also ordered a Light My Fire army model, its the gold standard...... Changing my review to 5 stars, the vendor contacted me and replaced the bent rod. First rate vendor with an excellent product, will order again.
customer_reviews.author: william

customer_reviews.title: Excellent! Except for one thing.
customer_reviews.text: Just got it. I decided to give it a few strikes with the back of a Morakniv and it worked it’s way out of the wooden handle. 5 stars for the size and spark production... minus two for the adhesive used to hold it together. I sanded mine down a little and used some construction grade adhesive to hold it together. Hopefully it will stay together now.
customer_reviews.author: Jen Caruso

customer_reviews.title: Best I've Ever Bought
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased numerous fire steels over the years, but not until this one did I have one that worked very well. With the others I could only throw sparks, but with this one I can place the rod directly on the tinder and scratch back and forth a couple of times and generate a nice shower of sparks directly on the tinder for a quick light. I am very pleased and recommend this fire steel! The wooden handle and neck cord are a nice plus!
customer_reviews.author: K. Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Rod falls out within 24 hours!
customer_reviews.text: While I will not speak for every frod these folks may sell I will say mine was garbage. It looked nice! Until the rod fell out somewhere within 24 of my TWO WEEK camping trip. So I'm here in the sticks four miles in the wooded wilderness attempting to practice my bushcraft and I ended up having to fall back on my emergency supplies. Less than stellar guys - less than stellar. I will give thia company an opportunity to redeem themselves if they contact me and are willing to send a other one. But until that time I would personally not at all recommend this product. If you do MAKE SURE you carry a backup.
customer_reviews.author: Mykle Grey

customer_reviews.title: Not as shown!!  Only a fraction of the length shown!!
customer_reviews.text: Why can't you provide actual phots of the different products? To send a really short variety is a real rip-off!!
customer_reviews.author: Philip R. Ronco

customer_reviews.title: Came apart during first day of use
customer_reviews.text: The rod and their striker worked well. During first day of my week of camping the rod separated from the handle. This was with normal usage and nothing extreme. Very disappointed with product.
customer_reviews.author: Bean Counter

customer_reviews.title: Breaks Easily
customer_reviews.text: Handle broke literally on my very first use of this product. Yes it looks nice & throws sparks well...but I wouldn't rely on this product in a survival situation seeing as how it easily breaks.
customer_reviews.author: Daywalker

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart on first trip
customer_reviews.text: The rod fell out of the handle after a couple uses. Fixed it with gorilla glue so we’ll see how that goes but shouldn’t have to do that after one camping trip.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Best firestarter I've used
customer_reviews.text: Have you ever tried starting a fire with a magnesium stick, or BlastMatch? I have, and they are difficult to use and do not work well. This fire steel on the other hand is fantastic. I ordered the large 1/2 inch version and am very pleased with it. With a handful of dry grass I had flames in about 15 seconds. It puts out a large shower of hot sparks with minimal effort, and should last a VERY long time. Nothing to break or damage. It's simple and sturdy. Would definitely buy again. I keep mine in my EDC pack.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Handle broke right away
customer_reviews.text: The handle broke off the first time I went to use it. It looks cheaply glued on. I was able to get a few good sparks but the rod is too short especially without the handle that I can’t use it now. It will go in my zombie bag.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Ann

customer_reviews.title: disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The ferro rod has only been used a few times and is now "ringed" and no longer strike-able. The small metal file that comes with it is extremely difficult to work against the rod as well. It also has come out of the wooden handle already making that useless as well.
customer_reviews.author: sitw

customer_reviews.title: Big Mistake!!!
customer_reviews.text: I paid $19 for this Fire starter and after 5 tries the Wooden handle broke off!! I bought this fire starter thinking it was a quality product..very disappointed. This is useless without the handle!!
customer_reviews.author: victor

customer_reviews.title: 1/2" ferro rod
customer_reviews.text: Received the item today. Tested at home before leaving for my weekend trip. I own 6 different rods and comparatively (in conjunction with the larger surface area) this thing throws fantastic sparks/showers. You can drench tinder with this beast, it must have a very high magnesium content. Very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Seal1207

customer_reviews.title: rod can come out of wood.
customer_reviews.text: The rod does not go very deeply into the wood and is not very well secured. The wood got a crack in it, and the rod fell out easily. I repaired mine by putting super glue in the hole, putting the rod back in, and then letting it cure while held in a vice. Seems to stay together again now. Overall, it's not a very robust design.
customer_reviews.author: Cramer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Nice size, easy to handle and use. I'm glad I watched the video on it because I learned that you need to scrape the black film off of it before you can make sparks. I like the little tool attached to the convenient cord it has. You can use it to create sawdust to start your fire before adding some tinder and, of course, as the striking stick. I was able to create sparks very easily. Video also suggested soaking cotton in petroleum jelly as it will catch fire easily and hold a flame in less than perfect conditions. Great for camping. I'm starting an emergency "go kit" and this is a great item to have.
customer_reviews.author: DebiP

customer_reviews.title: Don't Start a Forest Fire
customer_reviews.text: This Friggin thing is the bomb-diggity of Fire starters. I think they should ship these with some sunglasses because the amount of sparks this thing puts off is enough to cause your pupils contract for 10 minutes. No but in all honestly this is a very high quality Ferro rod. While it is slightly more expensive than the others, consider that it is a while Ferro rod so there isn't any of that Wal-Mart style slotted trickery. Used it in a week long backpacking trip. Even became a cigarette lighter after my buddy dropped his Zippo in the River although I wouldn't recommend for obvious reasons.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell Speaks

customer_reviews.title: Nice sparks but rod popped out.
customer_reviews.text: Used it last night, got great sparks but the rod popped out of the handle and dropped into the fire pit. Was able to put it back in the handle but will need to glue it when I get home.
customer_reviews.author: Steve-a-reno

customer_reviews.title: A good fire steel
customer_reviews.text: A good fire steel, I like the size and feel of it. It throws off really good sparks and it should last a really long time. I like the wood handle and it's nice that it includes a striker, it works well with this or a knife and I've never had issues getting sparks from it. I did treat the handle with beeswax to keep it from absorbing water or splitting.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Even after a "break-in" the sparks from this are marginal
customer_reviews.text: This fire starter has a good handle and size. The black coating on the outside needs to be scraped off before any sparks are generated. The included striker is not very good since it does not conform to the rod well and one side is much better at removing metal and making sparks. Compared to another fire starter I have, the sparks do not seem to last as long and thus it is somewhat harder to start a fire. The product does work after getting the rod to bare metal but I have seen better.
customer_reviews.author: K&R in SD

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I started my first fire with this after watching their video and a little practice. This definitely does the job if you have the right starter material. I'm not using it at the moment in a survival situation (!) -- just for starting the fire in my woodstove. One small thing--it was not clear to me how to order the larger diameter fire starters. I looked around because I thought I would buy the largest one "just because." I settled for the smallest size, which I guess is the "standard" size. It will last for a long while anyway, so it is not a huge deal.
customer_reviews.author: Matt P.

customer_reviews.title: Solid. Best I’ve seen around.
customer_reviews.text: There are many versions of this item available and I already have several myself. This is hands down the best one I’ve ever had. The stylish wood handle is solid and the size (I have the large) is sturdy. One test with the included key was a rain storm of sparks and molten magnesium. Seriously impressed. If you can’t start a fire with this tool then you can’t start a fire.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew C.

customer_reviews.title: Crap!
customer_reviews.text: Same as the crap you can buy at Wall Mart , glued in the handle 1/8 inch, 3rd strike and it came apart .
customer_reviews.author: Robert Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: It fails to start very soft and very dry grass, or anything else I’ve tried. The puny sparks it produces are nowhere close to what the manufacturer shows on its video. Completely useless “tool”. Back to my trusty made in USA matches.
customer_reviews.author: Cowgirl In the Sand

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these before and managed to lose it on a trip. The wood and black blends in with the forest floor a little too well. Bought another and swapped the black cord for some hi-viz yellow paracord. Definitely a nice way to spruce it up. It throws nice sparks with the included tool or the spine of a good knife.
customer_reviews.author: Penn-Bushcrafting

customer_reviews.title: The best I have ever tried.
customer_reviews.text: My husband says this fire starter is the best he ever used and he has tried several others. It is light weight, easy to pack any place in your back pack or pocket very easy to use and starts a fire quickly anytime anywhere. Thanks for offering such a terrific product.
customer_reviews.author: S. Russell

customer_reviews.title: Well Built--Lots of Sparks
customer_reviews.text: Although a tad bit more expensive than some fire starters this one is well worth it. I am not sure what the mix is on the ferrocerium rod is but you can generate a lot of sparks, in addition the wood handle is comfortable to hold, there is good balance between the handle and rod, the striker is very impressive is strong enough to get great leverage on the rod but yet is still compact enough to easily store. In addition the seller is a dream to work with very customer and service oriented. This is the best fire steel I have purchased must have for any survival kit.
customer_reviews.author: boatersteve

customer_reviews.title: My Benchmade 162 now has sparks
customer_reviews.text: Recently bought a Benchmade 162 and my search to find a good piece of fire steel brought me here. This works great with my knife and sends a shower of sparks for fire starting. Looks awesome within the sheath as well. I really liked the wood handle to match the leather of the sheath. Pleased with this one and it really compliments the overall look of the Bushcrafter 162. The included striker works just as well as the knife when producing sparks and I use the included lanyard to secure everything to the sheath as a backup from falling out.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Nearly burned my house down lighting a candle
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited when it came. I immediately tried using it in my kitchen and panicked when it sparked on the first try. Extremely happy that it was so easy to use! This was originally bought for a camping trip that had to be cancelled due to the Covid-19 crap. Now I am using to light candles around the house and tricking my kids that I am slowly developing super powers. Awesome purchase! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Ilian

customer_reviews.title: Works Quite Well
customer_reviews.text: Picked up this fire starter a couple of weeks ago, just to have on hand, in case. Admittedly, I haven't had much use for one in the past and once I figured out that the blacking needed to be removed in order to work properly, well it works just fine. I haven't tried it on dry tinder alone, but have used vaseline coated cotton balls as a catalyst and they fire right up. This stick & striker are good sized, sturdy and throw out nice spray of sparks. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Us and Them

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work when I needed it to
customer_reviews.text: Had a decent stack of tinder and dry wood but I just couldn't get enough sparks to light it up. I purchased the fatty version of this fire steel. Needed to use a lighter to start my fire instead. I'll be trying again in the future and update my review once I figure this fire steel out. As for now, I wouldn't recommend this due to the lack of sparks. (It could also definitely be user error so I'm refraining from leaving a 1 star review at this moment)
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: If you have an outdoorsman in your family/friends this is a great gift. Never hurts to be prepared for the ...
customer_reviews.text: Got as a gift for a family member and after opening it I wished I would have bought two more. One for myself and one for my son. I will be placing that order soon. This fire starter is actually small enough to carry it with no problems and durable enough to be confident that it will be protected in my pocket while hiking/camping/hunting. If you have an outdoorsman in your family/friends this is a great gift. Never hurts to be prepared for the worst and with this I wouldn't be afraid of being able to get a fire started. Would definitely recommend this product. Kimberly Grubb
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly1965

customer_reviews.title: hard to use
customer_reviews.text: Really cool tool but it is difficult to use. It was fun to play with but it isn't very practical for starting fires. I was able to start one but it took a lot longer than a lighter. (I realize this is a 'duh' moment, but I just want to give people a heads up you have to invest quite a bit of time to start a camp fire. However, if you don't mind that it does work and will start a fire.)
customer_reviews.author: Frogwear

customer_reviews.title: Great item!
customer_reviews.text: I found that the protective coating is exactly that, protective! It takes a little to break through and really get it peeling off. Don't be afraid to bear down, this is a serious ferro rod. Note the more sharp edge on the scraper. One you get it clean and sparking, it throws a shot like crazy. Even here in the famously wet Pacific Northwest USA, I'm confident in my tooling now. I'm replacing a cheap common brand that took much more fine tinder and care to be sure you got the job done.
customer_reviews.author: mo

customer_reviews.title: It’s not easy at all
customer_reviews.text: The videos make this look like a cascade of sparks will shower down on your tinder. That’s not how it works. Only a strong adult could manage this and it’s still extremely hard. If the sticks were much longer, it wouldn’t be so tough.
customer_reviews.author: Bill C

customer_reviews.title: I've bought several... This one is the best
customer_reviews.text: So, I taught my son how to make starter fiber from the inside of cedar bark and dried kudzu fibers. I gave him another starter (that I didn't like), and try as he might, he struggled for long enough to be frustrated. Finally, sensing he was about to quit trying, I gave him this starter. After four or five strikes, it caught and within minutes we had a fire. Now, we're fighting over this; 'the good one'! LOL!
customer_reviews.author: Tracer

customer_reviews.title: Pits developed over time
customer_reviews.text: I've had this ferro rod for 11 months. I checked it out initially, striking it a few times to make sure it produced decent sparks, which it did, then I stored it in an emergency survival pack. I pulled out recently and found there were pits developing on the rod. The largest of which developed on the painted side, opposite from my test strikes. It looks to me like it was a manufacturing defect since the device was stored in a cool dry place and left untouched for a year. As an emergency survival tool, I'd prefer an item that does not deteriorate so rapidly.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Lewis

customer_reviews.title: *Like dragon's breath*
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical that this product was really better than it's competitors, but I have bought several of the cheaper versions and found them lacking. Well....it lived up to the hype. This ferro rod shoots copious amounts of sparks, intermingled with bits of the rod flying in burning bits towards the tinder bundle. No "cheating" necessary [i.e. vaseline coated cotton balls or a hint of lighter fluid on the tinder} It is definitely up to the job. I now know that all Ferro-rods are not created equal. Spend the few extra bucks and this little beauty may be the last one you ever have to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Damon

customer_reviews.title: Good length/thickness. Throws great Sparks even with the included ...
customer_reviews.text: Good length/thickness. Throws great Sparks even with the included scraper. Not sure what the curved indent is for though. The wood is sanded and smooth but is bare. The handle is comfortable and you won't get fatigued like when using the smaller handles ones. Applying/varnish yourself which isn't a problem. You'll also have to scrape off the black paint/covering time reveal the silver underneath. Only con is I was striking it instead of scraping and a tiny piece chipped off in the cneter towards the end. As long as you treat it right it shouldn't be a problem so I'm giving this a great 4 stars. You should absolutely buy this as your primary fire starter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: rains down moulten steel goodness.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent fire steel. Fit perfectly in my 5/8 inch kydex sheath add=on as well. One stroke of the knife or striker and this things brings the heat. Ignites fat wood better than most others I used before. The length is just perfect as well. If you looking for a high quality fire steel this is it. It is very soft so it is not one that will last 20000 strikes but if it were it wouldn't work well for fire craft. You cant go wrong with this one. If you are feeling creative the handle can be stained to match your sheath or knife scales.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Clark

customer_reviews.title: Sparks Galore!
customer_reviews.text: I took this out camping this weekend for the first time and -- wow -- this thing makes great sparks for fire-starting! It's not just that it makes a lot of sparks; the sparks last a half-second or so, giving them time to catch whatever you're trying to light. Combine this with some good firestarter material and you have a tool that can save your life. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ross D. Martin MD

customer_reviews.title: Firestarting made easy
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size. Not so large you don't want to pack it but large enough to use quickly and easily in any conditions. Throws an excellent spark with fairly minimal effort. Had no trouble lighting decent tinder with 1 or 2 strikes. Big enough and well-enough made that this will probaly outlast me. The striker has multiple uses and even comes with a section for stripping magnesium from one of those rods if you have one. I got this on a Lightning Deal but would definitely buy another one or two of these at full price if I decide to keep backups in different locations.
customer_reviews.author: NibberJammies

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: This fire steel does a great job and throws sparks much better even than a LMF Army. I like the design, the handle is comfortable to hold, and the striker is actually useful. The lanyard/necklace of the fire steel is well thought out. If you'd like to wear it around your neck, it works well. If you'd like to keep it in a loop on a sheath, it's easy enough to untie or remove.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Awesome fire starter
customer_reviews.text: Very cool. I will get a lot of use out of this and it is just good to have in case of an emergency. The striker also has a ruler on it which is useful when navigating using a map. Nothing about this product feels cheap and I had no issues creating a spark. I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: MelanieTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Ferro rod
customer_reviews.text: It does what it is suppose to do. The fatty 1/2 " is a little heavy if your backpacking long distance for days. Use around the camp site is very good. It really throws the sparks when used with my Garberg.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell Family

customer_reviews.title: Pre-review to be used soonish...
customer_reviews.text: Ok so Amazon has been bugging me to review this so, which by 2-3rd email I caved...annoying, but I've been excited the same to use it. I bought in prep to a backcountry trip in the coming months. The item is: -EXACTLY AS PICTURED...or I'd uploaded a photo -just feels solid/quality (tba how it operates in weather elements ie: gets wet) -lightweight + confidence I'll have fire checked off the necessity list
customer_reviews.author: Barbs87

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: Always good to have a fire steel around in winter. Never know if you might get stuck. Knowing how to use it in that event is important (finding dry wood and safe spot to make fire). I keep Vaseline cotton balls with it for helping get a fire going. I heard about the steel separating from the handle on older versions but the epoxy they used feels rock solid on this one.
customer_reviews.author: CPUDoc

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: The striking steel comes on a long length of paracord - long enough that the two pieces can stay tied together even while using them, so it's impossible to lose just one piece even for ADD people like me who lose everything! It does cone coated in black paint so you need to scrape that off before use, but once you do, it strikes sparks very easily. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Fitzy

customer_reviews.title: Works amazing. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: WOW!!!! This is a great fire starter. I've yet to see another that throws more sparks then this one. The striker that is attached to it with the neck lanyard is perfect as well. I have a few of these. I've started easily 100s of fires and it has very little wear.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Wieser

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Firestarter
customer_reviews.text: This was a step up for me. My other fire starters worked, but I found them ergonomically uncomfortable. I've started two fires with this model so far. I plan to put it through the rounds this winter. I would definitely recommend this to anyone. I wore it around my neck for a bit, but it would probably be best in a vest or some kind of case.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Money wasted.  Just short of worthless.
customer_reviews.text: Handle is loose and falling out after a few uses. Too short to do anything but skin your knuckles. The included thin metal tool is garbage (and I will throw away sadly as it makes no sense to keep something so useless attached to the tool). The bummer about buying a ferro rod solution that you have not tried before is that; by the very nature of the product, you are consuming it as you use it so hard to feel good about a return. I won't return this, but I truly regret my purchase. I'll buy something else now and write off the loss.
customer_reviews.author: don daugherty

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure the dimensions are shown somewhere in the description, but this is a puny little piece of ferro-rod and barely generates any sparks. I bought a thick bar somewhere else and it damn near sets fire to a hardwodd floor! I'm no expert on this product, but it feels like a rip-off. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Koko

customer_reviews.title: Great size, excellent grip!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after a friend recommended it. We like to try out our bushcraft skills for fun, and this far surpasses the standard mag lighter! The wood handle provides an excellent grip. We haven't used it enough to testify to longevity, but our friend has had one for a long time, and claims it outlasts the standard mag lighter significantly.
customer_reviews.author: Kim D.

customer_reviews.title: A little harder than I'd like
customer_reviews.text: A ferro rod that is too hard will last forever because you'll get very few sparks. A ferro rod that is too soft will not last long but you'll have a blazing fire in moments. This one tries to find a happy medium and would be good for survival, but as a car camper I'd rather have something a bit softer.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed!
customer_reviews.text: Not nearly as good as the 2.0 light my fire! In a side by side this ferro rod sucked! Wasted my money.
customer_reviews.author: T. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Nice bit of equipment!
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. I like the size, and it sparks well. No problem starting the first fire using plain dryer lint as tinder, so I'm sure it will be fine for my usual fire starting materials. For people who had difficulty using a ferro rod for the first time, remember that you do have to scrape the black finish off the rod to get good sparks. Do that, and you shouldn't have a problem. Also remember that the finer and smaller your tinder, the better your chances are of getting a fire kindled. Use cotton balls with petroleum jelly for practice. Shredded birch bark works well, too. Patience, patience, patience! ;) Planning to use this for camping and backpacking.
customer_reviews.author: Hollis C. Barton

customer_reviews.title: Sparky
customer_reviews.text: Protective coating came off pretty quick. Makes good sparks (3/8"). I suspect could have been a little cheaper with slower shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Publius

customer_reviews.title: Great handle, not too big and not too small.
customer_reviews.text: I have taken this rod on several camping trips now. It really seems to be the perfect size and weight. Not bulky or easy to loose. It is larger than many rods I have had in the past, but the neck loop, striker and handle are just right for easy use, packing and striking. The length is just right allowing you to get close to your tender, while delivering a bright shower of sparks on target.
customer_reviews.author: a

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: I looked at so many products and didn't want to order something that was going to be difficult or not work as advertised. This product works exactly as advertised. I was finally convinced when I saw the video posted with the product description. If you have never used one, I suggest you watch it too. Even if you have used one you may learn something. A++++++++++ all the way.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: Can't miss firestarter
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight,Wooden handle for stiff cold hands, striking tool has lots of uses, including a pop -a-top for a brew after you get nice and warm.
customer_reviews.author: Hugh Hubble

customer_reviews.title: VERY SOLID PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good product. If you truly want the experience of camping or bushcrafting, this is a great tool to have. Product works very well, and the scraper/kindling maker is a very nice bonus. 10/10 would recommend this to anyone who is wanting a good fire starter. The company also sends a video on how to use the product when you receive it, which was very thoughtful. Overall, I am very satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Savedra

customer_reviews.title: Good quality product
customer_reviews.text: I am most pleased with Fire starter. It has a nice wood handle On the fire steel to grip. You can use the end of Fire start to create wood shavings from wood to get your fire started if you don’t have fat wood. I purchased a second one for my daughter so that she would have one too. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Marion L. Bracey

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I am not very happy with this product. The product is very expensive and not a made in Germany. I expect it made in China.
customer_reviews.author: MAG

customer_reviews.title: Great for recreational use
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. Shower of sparks sufficient to ignite tinder or char cloth. Thin rod will not last under sustained use but that scenario will likely not occur. If it is a concern get the 1/2 inch version. Wood handle is nice but will eventually fall off. I’m a casual camper so this works great for me.
customer_reviews.author: RodaSwen

customer_reviews.title: NICE
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nicely crafted product. I will replace the cord with a small length of small shock cord to minimize the bulkiness of the attached cord. I am still practicing with it and am surprised how hard it is to get a good spark shower generated.
customer_reviews.author: FLOR

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I’m new at survivalist/outdoors and I’ve NEVER tried to start a fire with anything other than matches or a lighter. I bought this rod and a Mora Garberg Bushcraft knife ($39) and tried lighting dryer lint on my back porch as a test. It ignited on my first try; it took me maybe 5 or 6 strikes. I’ve posted the video. I’m amazed. It just works. I’ll recommend this to anyone. I’ve only had it a few hours, so I can’t comment on the durability, but I’m very happy so far.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel T.

customer_reviews.title: Should be called the "Spark storm"
customer_reviews.text: A wonderful little device. This thing produces literal showers of sparks and anyone should be able to get a fire started with one of these in short order. I've got a lot of different firestarters and have used a lot more over the course of forty-plus years of prepping, camping, etc. (including rubbing sticks together) and this is the best I've ever seen or used. It is well-made, sturdy, and simple - three things which make it a true "survival" tool. I got one to start with, but will be ordering more in the near future.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald D. Morley

customer_reviews.title: Best fire starter ever!
customer_reviews.text: If you’re looking for the ultimate, kick ass fire starter, you won’t find a better one. This one’s a serious lifelong starter built to outlast you. Many times, a single strike does it as long as you position it correctly. Really shoots off hot sparks.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Best this is.!!!
customer_reviews.text: This fire steel is the best IV used and is nice and beefy ...hot long lasting spark. The company is very quick to ship and wrote me a thank you letter for my purchase and made sure I was completely satisfied. Great product. Great customer relations. I will definitely buy again and this company is definitely on my go to list.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.&MrsA

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't trust my life on it
customer_reviews.text: The striker is small and with the painted coating makes it very difficult to develop a spark against the rod. So I switched to using my pocket knife. Easily got sparks with my knife, but ferro is ferro, so that's not really a pro or con. The big con is how quickly the rod came unglued from the handle rendering it relatively useless. I wouldn't trust it in a survival situation. I wasn't impressed with the quality for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Throws tons of sparks and works well to light fires. Not much more to tell. It does what its supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for camping and "go" bag!
customer_reviews.text: I gave it as a gift. We tried it out in the sink. Definitely provides a good stream of hot sparks. Small size is perfect for an emergency or "go" bag. No worries about fire starting anymore. There is also a twig scraper included for shaving off tinder.
customer_reviews.author: D.W.

customer_reviews.title: Light My Fire
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Uberleben fire starter. I was well satisfied with the first but this unit is like a flame thrower. I broke it in shooting sparks into the kitchen sink. It produced blinding light, heat, lingering smoke in the air, and a display that resembled a mini 4th of July. It lights a cotton ball with one strike. Even if I never really need it in the woods, I’ll get my money’s worth out of it because it will entertain me for hours playing with it. And, any product named “Uberleben” will get high marks for the all important coolness factor.
customer_reviews.author: Daveheer

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality Fire Steel
customer_reviews.text: Used this item on a recent backpacking trip in the Allegheny National Forest, worked terrific. The striker also works very well, no need to use the spine on your knife. I was pleasantly surprised with the quality of this item when I received it and tested it out. I was expecting a less quality product than what it turned out to be, based solely on the price. I will be purchasing another in the near future. I would recommend this product to anyone looking for a good fire steel.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: phenomenal product
customer_reviews.text: The wood grip is sanded neatly, the rod is seated accurately and is perfectly straight and is throws fantastic sparks. I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Seal1207

customer_reviews.title: A sure thing when you need a fire.
customer_reviews.text: This product has a wood handle with lanyard and a scraper tool to produce sparks. A product video demonstrates the correct way to use the tool. The lanyard is long enough to use the tool while striking the rod. Overall, I am completely satisfied with the components and feel of this tool. I bought 5 of these for my cub scouts to learn how to use and plan to add to my own emergency bags in my vehicles. Great product, fast shipping and 100% satisfied customer.

customer_reviews.title: Striking Out
customer_reviews.text: Well, broke on third use. The adhesive used to hold the ferro rod in the wooden handle is pathetic. Epoxied it and it works. Once the coating is removed from the ferro rod it works as expected. Better products on the market.
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: Is there a difference?
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what amount of magnesium is mixed with the ferrocium, if any, but my 3/8 worked as expected. It also looks exactly like the photo. I wish i could order another 1/2 and have the same results. I would love a 1/2 that had the same size handle and same results as this 3/8.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Lunt

customer_reviews.title: Delivered on time and just a beautiful objet d' art in its own right
customer_reviews.text: After scraping the black coating off, this ferro rod shot mad sparks. Just 2-3 strikes caused our Vaseline-soaked cotton balls to go up in flames that burned, unattached to wood or kindling for several minutes. The striker would not start our commercially produced tinder, but I blame the tinder. Delivered on time and just a beautiful objet d' art in its own right. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Looks great with leather sheath fire steel loops.
customer_reviews.text: I own several LT Wright knives which have a slot for a 3/8 inch fire steel in their leather sheaths. Given the cost and quality of the knives, the Uberleben are an ideal compliment as a first rate handsome addition. The only modification that I made was to remove the paracord and striker and replace it with a fabric covered rubber band like hair tie. I widen the hole a bit, insert the tie, once its through hole put the remainder through the loop then loop that below the sheath slot. Looks great and is fully secure.
customer_reviews.author: Sarge

customer_reviews.title: Showers of sparks
customer_reviews.text: As good as if not better than all the other ferro rods I've tried, and beautiful wood handle makes it a joy to use. A bit heavier than the plastic-handled items, but not overly so. Should last you a lifetime with normal use. Winner!!
customer_reviews.author: Tartan Hiker

customer_reviews.title: So much fun
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my hubby for Father’s Day. He loves it! We had so much fun plaining with and setting lots of little fires. I will mention as others did that there is some sort of coating over the stick. It will not light until you scrape that coating off. It was on akward few minutes as my husband thought it wasn’t going to work at first. We will be buying this as gifts for my brothers in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Faith

customer_reviews.title: Fire Starter, no doubt about it.
customer_reviews.text: Well Made and ready to start a fire if needed. With just a little self training this could be a lifesaver or a simple way to start a fire if you forget your matches or a butane lighter. I prefer this over the stated ones in the last sentence. It won't let you down, prepare, prepare, prepare so you can use this to get the fire started. There is a lot of kindling out there, and around your house.
customer_reviews.author: Frustrated in Indiana

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money
customer_reviews.text: As an avid hiker and outdoors enthusiast, I have to say this fire starter packs a punch. Be sure to watch the manufacturer video if you are a first time user (the components have a coating that must first be removed) and you will be pleased with the result. An essential tool for every hiker, backpacker, or of course crazy prepper (you know who you are). As always take only pictures and leave only footprints.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Siedschlag

customer_reviews.title: Uberleben Zünden Bade Boom!
customer_reviews.text: Much easier than a box drill, use this. If nothing else, you bought it from a cool place that vikings used to live, so you feel good about the purchase. yes, works great, and has an authentic uber name for an uber cool piece of backwoods swag. Don't leave home without it.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Must have tool!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome fire starter! Check out the video to see it in action. Perfect size and produces enough spark to get the job done. 100% recommend.
customer_reviews.author: VM88

customer_reviews.title: Absolute BEST Ergonic Design of them ALL !
customer_reviews.text: Nothing Beats WOOD in heat or Cold - against the Hand. FIre-Steel is a Great Performer, good dia. selections; and Superb FUnction. Yet - the wood could use a few fine sandings on the Edges for Personal FIt ...
customer_reviews.author: Star Man

customer_reviews.title: A Real Nice Product
customer_reviews.text: My Fire Starter is a really nice product and I have wanted to order this one for a while, as it had been out of stock. Im glad it came back in stock and I was able to order it. Shipping was great and it came faster than expected and this product is perfect for traveling, camping, hiking and when we go on our biking trips. It will work great to start a quick fire. Thank You for the great service.
customer_reviews.author: Bobbi Bosse

customer_reviews.title: Very nice fire starter striker and rod.
customer_reviews.text: This fire starter is amazing. I am a Scout leader and use these instead of matches or a lighter to show the boys this is all you need. The Überleben Zünden Fire Starter! is one of the best I have used. More sparks of the rod regardless of what steel I use. I usually use the back of my knife. It also has a very nice tradition feel and can be worn around the neck or hanging from your belt.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Rosenberg

customer_reviews.title: Overall great product...BUT...
customer_reviews.text: Overall great product. Throws flames as it should however after only a few uses the wood handle came off. Just a sign of poor craftsmanship. I was able to superglue it and all seems fine. Other than this, all good.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Buy for the rod, not the scraper
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good fire starter...but it isn't great. The included scraper might be fine for emergencies. It's adequate for scraping and sparking but it's too small to really hold tightly. A sturdy knife blade works much better and creates a fountain of sparks. The rod is first class. The wooden knob/handle makes it easy to control and hold. I think for what this is and it's downsides it's a little pricey.
customer_reviews.author: Carl STop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: This firestarter is wonderful. The handy "tool" that comes attached to the ...
customer_reviews.text: Showers of sparks! This firestarter is wonderful. The handy "tool" that comes attached to the lanyard has a sharp little edge on it, which provides a great place to strike your fire starter with. I've used it several times so far to start fires in the backyard and test it's sparking capabilities. Works wonderful, easy to send showers of sparks towards your tinder.
customer_reviews.author: Madison Wellington

customer_reviews.title: We all need one!
customer_reviews.text: Giving this as a Christmas gift. May end up buying one for my emergency kit. Love the handle attached to help in holding it securely. It appears to be made very well and I was encouraged to buy and try because of the great reviews and several videos I watched about this particular fire starter. UPDATE: Everyone that received one of these from me for Christmas, loved it and how well made it is.
customer_reviews.author: Lorelei

customer_reviews.title: A quality fire steel
customer_reviews.text: It tosses some great sparks. You can honestly feel the heat coming off as you strike. A friend that I camp with has a smaller steel by a different company. However, I seen the difficulty he has with such a short striking distance. Myself, I wanted something a little bit longer and easier to hold in the hand. This fit the bill exactly. I truly feel that this is a quality fire steel. Nice hot sparks was able to light a small tinder nest with ease. With the wooden handle, it's actually pleasant to hold while striking. and while just under the 2oz mark, won't really feel the weight in your pack.
customer_reviews.author: v

customer_reviews.title: Like the wood handle
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Like the wood handle. It would help a lot in slippery conditions. A "tad" shorter than I would like(If I was designing my perfect fire steel.) The attached striker is nice but the right knife works better. Only used it once but it seems like a good product.
customer_reviews.author: tom

customer_reviews.title: Steal came out on first hike
customer_reviews.text: Gave this to my son for his birthday. He wore it around his neck our first hike the steal came out. We could not find it. I thought this was well made and paid more for it than its competitors. How could I recommend this now?
customer_reviews.author: Fyador

customer_reviews.title: Best ferrocerium rod I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: This is the highest quality firesteel I've ever used. The handle is comfortable in the hand and the striker is very well designed. I've had problems with rods separating from the handle (other manufacturer's) so I removed the rod from the handle, cleaned off the glue residue and epoxyed it back in place. Should last for many years.
customer_reviews.author: Health Physicist

customer_reviews.title: Very good firesteel - not extremely soft though.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. I have bought several of these to go on some of my Bark River sheaths. This may be much cheaper than the more expensive ones on the market however they function extremely well. They are not very soft so if it is a super soft forested you are seeking look elsewhere. This however serves very good for it purpose of starting firebox lunches in the bush.
customer_reviews.author: GetOutdoorsNow

customer_reviews.title: Seems like an excellent product
customer_reviews.text: My only slight hesitation is that the "rope" for hanging it around your neck (so you don't loose it in a critical situation) is a bit short. I will have to just make another. Other than that it makes a nice shower of sparks.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Werner

product_meta.title: überleben Zünden Fire Starter | 5/16”, 3/8” or 1/2” Thick Bushcraft Fire Steel with Handcrafted Wood Handle | 12,000-20,000 Strikes | Traditional Survival Ferro Rod | Neck Lanyard
feature_bullets: HANDCRAFTED HARDWOOD HANDLE — Traditionally inspired materials and ergonomics. We’ve intentionally left the grip natural, ready to earn that seasoned finish. Oil & grit… bare, calloused hands.

BEST FERRO BLEND, PERIOD — Überleben’s Sånft-korr(TM) ferrocerium is the perfect balance between softness & durability, consistently outperforming the leading fire starters. Easily throw a 5,500ºF shower of molten sparks in any weather (waterproof), at any altitude.

MULTIPLE SIZE OPTIONS — At nearly 5-inches in total length, the Zünden is available in three thickness variations, including: Trad 5/16” (8mm): 12,000+ strikes, Pro 3/8” (10mm): 15,000+ strikes, and Fatty 1/2” (12.5mm): 20,000+ strikes.

DESIGNED FOR NECK CARRY — There’s no excuse. Even the Zünden Fatty weighs in at less than 3 oz. Includes Mil-spec 550 paracord lanyard + Multi-tool striker (straight-edge spine, concave tinder scraper, map scale, ruler, hex wrench… and most importantly, bottle opener).

HASSLE FREE GUARANTEE — If you’re not stoked, we’re not stoked. You shouldn’t pay for something you don’t love. If for any reason you’re not absolutely thrilled with your Zünden, let us know. We’ll fix it.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
